titleStmt.author: Case, William

analytic.title: TO THE RIGHT REVEREND FATHER in God THOMAS Lord Bishop Elect of CHESTER, my very good LORD.
analytic.author: Case, William

monogr.title: A sermon of the nature and end of repentance : shadowed in the ministerie of Iohn the Baptist. Preached the Sunday afore Lent. 1613
monogr.author: Case, William

div.head: TO THE RIGHT REVEREND FATHER in God THOMAS Lord Bishop Elect of CHESTER, my very good LORD.
div.p:
BEing heretofore moued for some considerations to publish this Sermon: I remained somewhat doubtfull in the Dedication thereof, vntill the newes of your Lordships aduancement quickly setled my resolution. For where better could I haue implor'd Patronage, then where both eminent authoritie of Place, as also your Lordships particular fauour towards me, seemed no lesse enforcedly to inuite by loue, then compell by dutie? For which respect I haue now presumed vpon your Lordships acceptance, trusting the rather to
obtaine pardon for this my bold intrusion, and also indulgent censure of these my vnworthy labours, presented to your learned view as chalenging the goodnesse of your Lordships disposition, and freely offered courtesie, guiltie of this my attempt, and a chiefe cause hereof.

The Lord God guide and assist your Lordship with the blessed directions of his most holy spirit, in the discharge of your high calling in this life, and in the life to come giue you the reward of immortalitie and euerlasting glory.

closer.signed: Your Lordships in all duetie to be commanded WILLIAM CASE.
